oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Work camps; Construction camps; Construction workers; Construction; Road construction; Construction equipment
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-193
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Composite of fourteen photographs showing the daily life of Civilian Conservation Corps Company 492.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Civilian Conservation Corps in Tennessee Collection, 1933-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Company 492 was organized in August 1937 at Camp TVA-22 near Norris Lake. The company operated 3 portable saw mills, creating rough and finished lumber. The company also fenced Tennessee Valley Authority boundaries, contructed truck trails for forest fire prevention, combated soil erosion, forested Tennessee Valley Authority marginal land, and built several recreational areas.
